content: widsith a sock pattern for colourful yarn widsith is an old english poem that only survives in one tenth-century manuscript known as the exeter book the poem is an account of the travels of widsith whose name means far journey these socks were inspired by a skein of variegated yarn sent to me by a swap partner across the sea the first version of these socks went through some changes to become this pattern much like texts copied from manuscript to manuscript changed and were changed along the way knittitude 2014 general information materials  1 skein of fingering weight yarn 100 g / 400 m the variegated yarn is hopeasäie gold 75% merino 20% nylon 5% stellina 100g = 400 m in the colourway mikael the green yarn is cascade heritage 75% merino 25% nylon 100g = 400m  a set of 2 5 mm dpns or needles or size to get gauge for your preferred method for knitting in the round  2 cable needles optional  a stitch marker to mark the beginning of round optional  sock blockers optional sizes women s small medium foot circumference of size s unstretched circa 8 20 cm the variegated socks are in size s knitted with 2 5 mm needles the green socks are in size m test knitted with 2 mm needles by the ravelry user lottanen gauge 28 sts and 42 row = 4 10 cm in stockinette stitch instructions the right and the left sock are identical make two for a pair cuff cast on 60 72 stitches * k1 p1* for 15 rounds set-up for leg work rounds 19-20 of leg pattern once see leg pattern chart or written instructions on page 4 leg repeat rounds 1-20 of leg pattern 3 times or as many times as you wish set-up for heel k3 to shift the beginning of round by three stitches heel flap the heel flap will be knitted across the next 25 37 stitches round 1 rs sl 1 k to end round 2 ws sl 1 p to end repeat these two rounds 11 13 more times work round 1 once more knittitude 2014 2 turn heel round 1 ws sl 1 p 13 19 p2 decrease p1 turn work round 2 rs sl 1 k 4 ssk k1 turn work round 3 ws sl 1 p until 1 stitch before the gap p2tog p1 turn work round 4 rs sl1 k until 1 stitch before the gap ssk k1 turn work repeat rounds 3-4 until all the heel stitches have been worked = 15 21 stitches on the sole gusset set-up pick up and knit 15 17 stitches along the heel flap or as many as you wish just make sure to pick up the same number of stitches on each side of the heel flap work the 35 35 instep stitches in stockinette pick up and knit 15 17 stitches along the heel flap knit 8 11 stitches this is
